description.narrative:
Bosnia and Hercegovina is one of the most energy inefficient countries, however it is still missing systematic approach, available financial mechanisms and allocation of investments into energy efficiency and the utilization of renewables. The intervention is supplementary to ongoing five years (2014 2018) UNDP ´s Green Economic Development (GED) project which aims to assist to BIH ´s Environmental Protection Funds in institutionalization of energy management and decision making processes of energy efficiency investments as well as in establishment of sustainable financial mechanisms for implementation of EE projects within public sector in BiH. Sweden is requested by UNDP to provide additional grant funds in order to set in motion a series of EE investments that would allow for the Project to be scaled up in sustainable manner. The project aims at setting up platform for energy efficiency by implementing five interlinked project components: PC 1 – Capacity building with three activity areas: (i) TA for capacity building at the Funds; (ii) developing and strengthening the technical and economic capacity of energy experts in BiH; (iii) implementation of additional detailed energy audits for public sector buildings. PC 2 – Institutionalization of energy management with three activity areas: (i) implementation of energy management information systems (EMIS) in public sector buildings in BiH; (ii) Training and capacity development for end users on EMIS, EE and energy management; (iii) Preparation of an EE baseline study for public sector buildings PC 3 – Legislative framework for financing of EE measures, with the activity area of drafting legislative documents, and development of financial mechanisms for the Funds. PC 4 – Infrastructure investments: implementation of EE measures in public buildings. PC 5 – Public awareness: raising public awareness in the field of energy efficiency, energy management and reduction of air emissions. Sweden will financially contribute to project components 1, 4, 5, contributing 12 million SEK per year over the 3­ year period 2015 - ­2017; totally SEK 36 million. Sweden’s contribution would finance about 30% of the total project cost of EUR 10.59 million. Other financiers are UNDP (2.2MEURO), Environmental Funds FBIH (2.2MEURO) and RS (TBC), Cantons and municipalities (2.6MEURO).
All funds provided by project parties involved in GED (Fund, SWEDEN, end­users/sub­national governments, UNDP) will be administered by UNDP. UNDP would be responsible for financial and project management assuring a transparent use of funds, clear and effective processes and political neutrality.

Bosnien och Hercegovina är ett av de mest energi ineffektiva länder men det saknas fortfarande systematiskt tillvägagångssätt, tillgängliga finansiella mekanismer och fördelning av investeringar avseende energieffektivitet och användning av förnybar energi. Interventionen är ett komplement till det pågående femåriga (2014 2018) UNDPs Grön ekonomisk utveckling (GED) projekt som syftar till att bistå till Bosnien och Hercegovinas miljöskyddsfonder beträffande institutionalisering av energihushållning och beslutsprocesser för investeringar i energieffektivitet samt etablering av hållbara finansiella mekanismer för genomförande av EE-projekt inom den offentliga sektorn i Bosnien och Hercegovina. UNDP har efterfrågat av Sverige att ge ytterligare bidragsmedel för att sätta igång en serie EE investeringar som skulle göra det möjligt för projektet att skalas upp på ett hållbart sätt. Projektet syftar till att inrätta en plattform för energieffektivitet genom att genomföra fem sammanlänkade projektkomponenter: PC 1 - Kapacitetsuppbyggnad med tre verksamhetsområden: (i) TA för kapacitetsuppbyggnad på fonderna, (ii) utveckla och stärka den tekniska och ekonomiska förmågan hos energiexperter i Bosnien och Hercegovina, (iii) implementera ytterligare detaljerade energibesiktningar av byggnader inom den offentlig sektor. PC 2 - Institutionalisering av energistyrning med tre verksamhetsområden: (i) implementering av energi ledningsinformationssystem (EMIS) av byggnader inom den offentliga sektorn i Bosnien och Hercegovina, (ii) utbildning och kapacitetsutveckling för slutanvändare av EMIS, EE och energihantering, (iii) beredning av en EE grundläggande studie för byggnader inom den offentliga sektorn. PC 3 - Lagstiftnings ram för finansiering av EE åtgärder, med verksamhetsområdet att utarbeta lagstiftningsdokument, och utveckling av finansiella mekanismer för fonderna. PC 4 – Investeringar i infrastruktur: genomförande av EE åtgärder i offentliga byggnader. PC 5 - Allmänhetens medvetenhet: att öka allmänhetens medvetenhet gällande energieffektivitet, energihantering och reducering av luftföroreningar. Sverige ska bidra ekonomiskt till projektetkomponenterna 1, 4, 5, genom att bidraga med 12 miljoner SEK per år under en 3 års perioden 2015-2017; totalt 36 miljoner SEK. Sveriges bidrag skulle finansiera omkring 30% av den totala projektkostnaden som uppgår till 10.59 M EUR. Övriga finansiärer är UNDP (2.2 M EUR), Miljöfonden FBiH (2.2 M EUR) och RS (TBC), kantonerna och kommunerna (2.6 M EUR).
Alla medel försedda av projektparterna som deltar i GED (Fund, SVERIGE, slutanvändarna / subnationella regeringar, UNDP) kommer att administreras av UNDP. UNDP kommer att ansvara för ekonomi- och projektstyrningen och säkerställa en transparent användning av medel, tydliga och effektiva processer och politiska neutralitet.

Project contribute to creation of favorable environment for investing in Energy Eficiency measures in BiH in order to improve the energy efficiency in public buildings and general.The GED Project helps BiH to meet its energy-related obligations under multilateral agreements (ECT, UNFCC), and support BiH in complying with the EU’s directives for energy efficiency and approximation of the EU environmental acquis

description.narrative: Within five years of implementation project achieved many good results, which many of them exceeded expectations. Project activities have expanded compared to the original initiative and much has been realized. Highlights of the main achievements of the project are: • Cooperation with the Environmental Protection Fund of the Federation of BiH and the Environmental Protection Fund of the Republika Srpska, with effective implementation of activities on institutionalization of energy management;• Cooperation with entity ministries (Federal Ministry of Energy, Mining and Industry, Federal Ministry of Spatial Planning, Ministry of Energy and Mining of Republika Srpska, Ministry of Spatial Planning, Construction and Ecology of Republika Srpska), Environmental Protection Funds, and the German Agency for International Cooperation (GIZ) regarding the preparation of bylaws (on energy management and information system), which will ensure harmonization and smooth implementation of the entity Laws on Energy Efficiency;• Cooperation with the state level through the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding with the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Relations of BiH, which resulted in various activities enabling smooth planning and reporting mechanism at state level;• Cooperation with the cantons in the Federation of BiH through institutionalization agreements, where six cantons adopted a Decision on obligatory data entry and monitoring, as well as at the federal level, where an agreement was signed with the Government of the Federation of BiH;• Cooperation with stakeholders at ministry level in Republika Srpska, where agreements have been signed with the Ministry of Education and Culture and the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare, as well as with the Ministry of Spatial Planning, Construction and Ecology;• Cooperation with the World Bank’s energy efficiency project started in 2016, which was established by a parallel financing agreement with the Ministry of Spatial Planning, Construction and Ecology of Republika Srpska;• Establishment of the Revolving Fund in the Federation of BiH, expanding varieties of applicants and projects, and enabling loan offers per applicant up to one million BAM in the public call in 2017, as well as 0% interest rate (in 2019 Environmental Protection Fund of the Federation of BiH decided to freeze the Revolving Fund);• Exceeded initial target for infrastructure works, which directly affected the achieved energy and cost savings, reduction of CO2 emissions, as well as the number of green jobs created;• Public lighting systems successfully piloted within the project;• Green jobs study developed, showing direct benefits and indicators based on energy efficiency measures implemented through infrastructure works;• Study on human development benefits and gender mainstreaming thought energy efficiency effects developed, showing impact of implemented measures, not only in comfort, but also social manner;• Typology for public sector buildings developed, in accordance with Directive 2012/27/EU. In figures, the key results achieved in the period from 2015-2019:• Number of detailed energy audits assessed, prioritized and ranked by Environmental Funds – more than 490• Number of participants on various training/educational programs for skills and knowledge development – 1,201• Number of female participants on various training/educational programs for skills and knowledge development – 503 (42%)• Number of energy efficiency infrastructure projects implemented with grant co-financing modality – 126• Number of beneficiaries of 126 implemented buildings – more than 85,000, of which more than 57,000 children • Total energy consumption savings within implemented public sector buildings – 53%• Total energy cost savings within implemented public sector buildings – about 3,3 million BAM• Amount of direct CO2 emission reduction – 10,263 t • Number of generated man-months “green jobs” – 1,429 • Amount of co-financing infrastructure projects during Sweden’s involvement (by end-users/institutions/Environmental Fund) – 6,9 million EUR • Number of people reached through marketing campaign – 2,000,000• Many bylaws and regulations in area of energy efficiency and related financial mechanisms developed
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
